title: 5 best Bank Holiday UK breaks: from bliss in Snowdonia to football breaks in Manchester
text:
If you've been swamped by work, and haven't managed to book your Bank Holiday escape, you've still got time to score a late bargain .
We've handpicked our favourite UK breaks below, from country getaways to city breaks in the north.
Fore more UK inspiration, see our 5 of the best cities to visit this holiday season , or 5 of the best European last minute deals from £87 .
1. Snowdonia: The Lodge Hotel Conwy, from £89
Watched over by the green peaks of the Carneddau Mountains, The Lodge Hotel Conwy provides a snug hideaway amid the dramatic landscapes, historic ruins and beachside communities of Snowdonia.
Explore or contemplate the heights of Snowdonia from a family-run country lodge located in the village of Tal-y-Bont.
You'll enjoy a stay for two in double or twin room with breakfast, 3-course dinner and bottle of wine on your first night.
2. Manchester: Football escape, Hotel Football, £85
Stay at the four-star Hotel Football in Manchester from £85 per night this Bank Holiday, and enjoy a footie fuelled escape in the north.
Stay at the new Hotel Football Old Trafford, just opposite Manchester United’s OId Trafford stadium.
3. Perthshire: Country stay at Duchally Country Estate, £195
Scattered around the grounds of the Duchally Country Estate and with views out across the Perthshire countryside, the luxurious lodges provide a base for Highland fling holidays, with leisure facilities included.
Each stay will be accompanied by a grocery starter pack featuring bread, butter, eggs, orange juice, milk, marmalade and jam. A bottle of sparkling wine will also help guests to settle in.
Those who want to take a break from cooking can rest up in the wood-panelled lounge bar which serves up breakfast, dinner and a selection of alcoholic beverages.
All meals can be created in the fully equipped kitchen which includes a fridge, four-ring hob, microwave and oven.
4. Ireland: Royal Hotel break with Irish Ferries, from £177
Enjoy three-nights-for-the-price-of-two with Irish Ferries Holidays on a self-drive package to the Royal Hotel in the seaside town of Bray.
The package includes cruise ferry crossings for your car from Holyhead to Dublin (or Pembroke to Rosslare).
This modern hotel has an indoor pool, leisure facilities, restaurant and bar. Only 45 minutes south of Dublin, it is a great base for enjoying the seaside, city sights and the Wicklow Mountains.
5. Surrey: Mercedes Benz break at Brooklands Hotel, £125 James Lipman A drivers dream: Mercedes Benz world in Surrey
Give your Bank Holiday some Va Va Vroom at the 4-star Brooklands Hotel in Surrey from £125 per night.
For the above price you'll get a one-night stay at the luxury Brooklands Hotel, overlooking the racetrack at Mercedes-Benz World - and located a short 15-minute walk away from aircraft and motorsports exhibits at Brooklands Museum.
